page.title: 04Transport-Leeswood area
page.content: On average 19 buses pass through Leeswood in a typical day.The buses go to or come from Mold and Wrexham. Treuddyn does not have so many buses; it has only 12 passing through a day. The buses are either single-deckers(42 seats) or double-deckers(72 seats). Although they run almost hourly they are rarely full exept on Saturdays. The majority of people apparently prefer to use their own transport;most families own at least one motor car. In addition to the scheduled services of the National bus company,the district has two privately-owned bus services operating on a casual or contract basis. There was a railway but it is now derelict,having been closed in 1950.
